topics.body:
I know I'm continuing to talk about violence in the world, no not talking about the sjw thing any more but violence in general, is it just me or is one of the reasons why violence gets so much attention because certain people can't deal with non-violence?

Before this gets into a big argument, *BUT* hypothetically maybe the reason why say murder gets so much media attention is that some people emotionally need to feel as though murder is still common in western civilization as sort of a emotional crutch?

Even though the number of deaths due to war per 100000 is at a record low, genocide is at a record low, murder in most first world countries at a record low, rape in most first world countries is at a record low and such people still freak out all the time about it and such.  Do certain people emotionally need world conflict to function?

To use an analogy it's like the argument by the opposition to the hiv prevention drug that is now on the market; they just outright say that the world "needs" hiv.  Do some people believe that the world "needs" war or such?

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55170ee163687266f8e30200#post_55170ee163687266f8e30200
Not to start drama or anything, but personally I think in fifteen years sexism, homophobia and racism will be completely 100% gone.

Before this turns into a argument wait until the bottom cause that one's really controversial even by my standards.

Before this gets into a discussion about such; rather what I mean by this is that biomechatronics is less than ten years from widespread adoption, ethnic plastic surgery is reaching widespread adoption and gender reassignment surgery is at a record low and continuing to drop (it's now on average only $20k whereas ten years ago it was easily $100k).  As well as a ton of other technologies coming out.  Hell the world's first head transplant is scheduled for 2017.


Basically what I mean by all this is that in 2025: you'll be able to change your gender medically cheaply, but you'll also be able to change your race and look completely different.  Say sexism will be gone because people will be going "what's a sex?" and all actual sexists will instead be rallying against biomechatronics calling it evil or such.  Racism will be gone and instead say the kkk will be rallying against ethnic plastic surgery.  Homophobia will be gone and instead the westboro baptist church will be rallying against gender reassignment surgery.



If you want a short list of things coming out by 2025 that will drastically change the world's culture:
Self driving cars.
Algae biofuel.
Ethnic plastic surgery reaching widespread adoption.
Autonomous robotic surgeons.
3d printed organs.
Head transplants.
Synthesized food.
Vertical farms.
Widespread adoption of designer babies (right now there are designer babies but they can only choose selected few genes and it's really expensive, but in say ten years it'll be cheap).
Widespread adoption of genetic engineering in humans.
70% of the minimum wage workforce replaced by robots.
Reprogrammed cells reaching widespread adoption in humans.
Neural bridges.

And potentially the most controversial of all:
[spoiler]
Ectogenesis (basically goodbye childbirth say hello to children born in factories in literal factory lines)
If you still don't know what ectogenesis is here's *exactly* what it means:
!http://stream1.gifsoup.com/view5/2352275/zim-s-birth-o.gif!
!http://i294.photobucket.com/albums/mm87/Tehila_2008/Matrix-pod-with-baby.jpg!
Imagine no more child birth; just fields upon fields of literal baby factories.  No more mothers, no more fathers, just ordered manufactured children to the point that the parents might not even be their actual parents; they might have just spent money on a dna donation.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
